section.title: 1812 AD - 1815 AD: Tambora, Indonesia VEI 7HoloceneEruptions EruptionTambora, Indonesia VEI 7Tambora, Indonesia
section.para:
VEI 7 Confirmed Eruption
Historical Observations

This was the first Eruption eruption within 'written' history that had the benefit of an extensive amount of information gathered by a wide range of individuals. The Stommel's in their book Volcano Weather: the story of 1816, the year without a summerstommel1983 provide a very detailed account of the sequence of events in North America in 1816.

One of the interesting things about the Stommel's research is the Cholera epidemics EpidemicCholera Cholera of mid-19Th century Europe may have resulted due to the spread of the disease by refugees from the India famine Famine of 1816Stommel1983

section.title: 3250 BC: Burkle Crater: Noah's Flood Biblical EventNoah's Flood Impact EventBurkle Crater EarthNoah's Flood FloodNoah's Flood
3195 BC: Low growth Irish Oak Tree Ring Event3195 BC Dendrochronology3195 BC Tree Ring Event
2900 BC: End of Piora Oscillation
2200 BC: Bond 3 Bond Event
2354 BC: Umm al Bini - The confusion of Civilizations Impact EventUmm al Bini EarthBabylonian Flood FloodBabylonian Flood
section.para: The discovery of Umm al Bini was a fluke of war. Sadam Hussine had drained the great lake that sat atop the crater exposing it to satellite photography.

I call this the Confusion of Civilization as there are two floods in this region. Biblical EventNoah's Flood Noah's flood a thousand year before and now the Babylonian flood. This flood was not as world wide as Noah's and left a distinct mark in history. In the digs in Iraq, there is a layer of mud over remains. The area of Umm al Bini would have been ocean estuary in 2,300BC's so the impact was more a mud spatter than a real water impact.
Tree ring dating places this event at 2,354 BC with a 9 year window of cold weatherBaillie1999.
The Egyptian Drought

section.title: 2354 BC - 2345 BC: Tree Ring Event Tree Ring Event2354 BC Dendrochronology2354 BC
section.para: Lasted 9 years.

section.title: 2200 BC - 2100 BC: 4.2 Kiloyear Event
1628 BC: Santorini/Thera VEI 7HoloceneEruptions EruptionSantorini/Thera VEI 7Santorini/Thera Tsunami1628 BC Santorini/Thera Atlantis Earthquake1628 BC Olympia
section.para:
VEI 7? Confirmed Eruption
Radiocarbon (corrected)

The Thera explosion is an interesting event to consider. First, the Minoan people appear to have packed and left before the creation of the caldera. Second, the unique color of the ejaculate seems to be the link to the 10 Plagues of Egypt as noted in the Bible. And third, the dating of this event shifts the birth and time of Moses as well as other dates in the Bible.

It is one of two calderas that have been remembered in folk lore. The other caldera is the Crater Lakes caldera in Oregon, USA. Native American Legions speak of a battle of the Gods with one throwing down the other.

section.title: 200 BC - 300 AD: Roman Age Optimum
150 AD: Masaya, Nicaragua VEI 5+HoloceneEruptions EruptionMasaya, Nicaragua VEI 5Masaya, Nicaragua
180 AD: Taupo, New Zealand VEI 7 EruptionTaupo, New Zealand VEI 7Taupo, New Zealand
section.para: This is called the Hatepe eruption. While this volcano is in the southern hemisphere, it was noted in both China and Rome as ash and red skis.
It was a VEI-7 event.

This volcano is outside the normal range of Global Winter events being south of the 30Th parallel. The fact that there were red skis recorded in Rome and China signifies that the sulfur dioxide crossed the equator. The magnitude of the explosion was the determining factor for its effect on the globe.

section.title: 512 AD: Rabul, New Britain VEI 6HoloceneEruptions EruptionRabul, New Britain VEI 6Rabul, New Britain
section.para: This event is noted in the ice cores as a sulfur event at 516 AD ± 4 years. Perhaps this is the explanation for the Saxon invasion of the Celtic side of Britain resulting the Braton Hill battle. The LHE list says 540 AD ±100 years.

section.title: 536 AD - 545 AD: Bond 1 Tree Ring Event Tree Ring Event536 AD Dendrochronology536 AD
section.para: Impact EventTabban and Kenmore Impact event by two bodies resulting in impact craters called Tabban and Kenmore in the Gulf of Carpeneria, Australia. The cold period lasted 9 years in the tree ring recordsBaillie1999. This impact left an impact in both the recorded history around the world and the climate proxies allowing for a reconstruction of what a global winter is like.
The cloud cover started on March 24, 535 and ended on June 24, 536. It's ocular density was 2 and a half times the explosion of Tambora (1815).

'There was a sign from the sun, the like of which had not been reported before. The sun became dark and its darkness lasted for 18 months. Each day, it shone for about four hours, and still this light was only a feeble shadow. Everyone declared that sun would never recover its full light again.'(30)

section.title: 540 AD: Tree Ring Event Baillie1999 Tree Ring Event540 AD Dendrochronology540 AD

1783 AD: Laki Eruption, Grimsvotn Volanco, Iceland VEI 4+ EruptionGrimsvotn Volanco, Iceland VEI 4Grimsvotn Volanco, Iceland
section.para: The famous volcanic event which started the great Benjamin Franklin asking the question of weither the Liki eruption had an effect on the weather in Europe and North America in the years following the eruption(39).

section.title: 1850 AD: Third Cold Point of the Little Ice Age
1859 AD: The Carrington Event: Solar Storm of 1859 Magnetic EventCarrington Event HistoricalCarrington Event Carrington Event
section.para: This was the largest Geomagnetic storm on the sun. It took 17 hours to travel to earth on a journey which normally take 3 days.

section.title: 1908 AD: Tunguska Event Impact EventTunguska HistoricalTunguska Tunguska
section.para: The first major Impact Event in recorded history. It took almost 15 years to find the explosion point due to its remoteness in Siberia. Recent models show an explosion of an asteroid above the earth with a small Impact Event. The wide spread destruction was due to the mid-air explosion.
People in London were able to read the new paper at night for 8 days after the event. It was heard around the world.

section.title: 2010 AD: Grimsvotn Volanco, Iceland VEI 4 EruptionGrimsvotn Volanco, Iceland VEI 4Grimsvotn Volanco, Iceland
section.para: This eruption caused desruptions to air travel in Europe. President Obama had to cut short his visit to Ireland due to worries about the ash cloud.
